Field.ElementLabel: Scoring information attached

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
MEAT, FISH AND POULTRY
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all numbers that apply.
Field.ElementLabel: 1. Which type of ground meat do you usually eat?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Regular hamburger (30% fat) 
 2, 2 Lean ground beef (25% fat) 
 3, 3 Extra lean/ground chuck (20% fat) 
 4, 4 Ground round (15% fat) 
 5, 5 Super lean (4% - 10% fat), ground sirloin (10% fat), ground turkey breast, ground chicken breast 
 6, 6 Eat no ground meat

Field.ElementLabel: 2. Which best describes your typical lunch? "Lunch meat" means ham, bologna, salami, pastrami, etc.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 <u>Cheeseburger</u>, <u>pizza</u>, <u>typical cheeses</u>, <u>egg dishes</u> (egg salad, quiche, frittata, etc) 
 2, 2 <u>Sandwich</u> (lunch meat, hamburger, grilled cheese,), <u>meat/chicken entree</u> (plain/fried), regular <u>hot dog</u> 
 3, 3 Skip lunch or <u>sandwich</u> (tuna, fish, peanut butter, chicken or turkey lunch meat/light mayo, etc), turkey <u>hot dog</u>, <u>vegetarian dishes</u> 
 4, 4 <u>Tuna sandwich</u> (w/mayo: 1 gm fat or less/Tbsp, <u>Veggie burger</u> (Garden, Boca), <u>entree</u> (fish [not fried], small bits of chicken or meat), <u>low-fat yogurt</u>, 
 5, 5 <u>Salad</u> (low-cal dressing), <u>low-fat vegetarian dishes</u>, <u>hot dog</u> (0-2 gm fat), <u>deli meats/fat free sandwich</u> (w/mayo: 1 gm fat or less/Tbsp), <u>bagel </u>(light cream cheese) 
 6, 6 <u>Fat free vegetarian dishes</u>, <u>salad</u> (fat free dressing), <u>Veggie dog</u>, <u>Garden Vegan</u> (fat free burger), <u>nonfat yogurt, dry cereal</u> (skim milk), <u>bagel</u> (fat free cream cheese)

Field.ElementLabel: 3. Mark all of the choices that reflect the entree at your main meal.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Cheese (Cheddar, Jack, etc), eggs, organ meats (liver, etc), pizza, vegetarian dishes <u>once a week or more</u> 
 2, 2 Beef, lamb, pork or ham <u>once a week or more</u> 
 3, 3 Very lean red meat (top round or flank steak), rabbit, veal, venison or elk <u>once a week or more</u> 
 4, 4 Chicken, turkey, crab, lobster or shrimp <u>twice a week or more</u> 
 5, 5 Fish, scallops, oysters, clams, low-fat vegetarian dishes <u>twice a week or more</u> 
 6, 6 Fat free vegetarian dishes, fat free seafood dishes <u>every day</u>

StructuredValue.Value: 3 Very lean red meat (top round or flank steak)

Field.ElementLabel:
4. Estimate the number of ounces of meat, cheese, fish and poultry you eat in a typical day.
Include all meals and snacks. (To guide you in your estimate (a piece the size of a deck of cards = 3 oz)

1 hot dog = 1 ½ oz
1 chicken thigh = 2-3 oz
1 slice cheese = 1 oz
4 strips bacon = 1 oz
½ chicken breast = 3 oz
1-inch cube cheese = 1 oz
1 small burger patty = 3-4 oz
average T-bone steak = 8 oz
meat in sandwiches = 2-3 oz

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Eleven or more ounces <u>a day</u> 
 2, 2 Nine to 10 ounces <u>a day</u> 
 3, 3 Six to 8 ounces<u> a day</u> 
 4, 4 Four to 5 ounces<u> a day</u> 
 5, 5 Up to 1 ounce cheese or 3 oz lean meat, poultry, shrimp, crab, lobster or 6 oz fish, clams, oysters, scallops<u> a day</u> 
 6, 6 None or up to 3 ounces shrimp, crab, lobster or 6 ounces fish, clams, oysters, scallops<u> a day</u>

StructuredValue.Value: 5 Up to 1 ounce cheese or 3 oz lean meat
6 None or up to 3 ounces shrimp

Field.ElementLabel: 5. Which of these have you eaten in the past month?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Bacon, sausage 
 2, 2 Canadian bacon, turkey or chicken sausage 
 4, 4 Vegetarian sausage (Morningstar links or patties, other soy sausage) 
 6, 6 None

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
DAIRY PRODUCTS AND EGGS
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all numbers that apply.
Field.ElementLabel:
6. Which do you usually use for drinking (don't forget lattes/mochas) or cooking?
(Most lattes/mochas contain whole milk unless you request otherwise).

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Whole milk 2, 2 Two percent milk 4, 4 One percent milk, buttermilk 5, 5 None or skim (nonfat) milk, nondairy beverages (Edensoy, Rice Dream, etc)

Field.ElementLabel: 7. Which toppings do you use?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Sour cream (real or imitation including IMO), whipped cream 2, 2 Light/low-fat sour cream, Cool Whip, Reddi-Whip aerosol dairy 3, 3 Cool Whip Lite, regular cottage cheese, whole milk yogurt 4, 4 Low-fat yogurt, low-fat cottage cheese, Reddi-Whip aerosol nondairy 5, 5 1% fat cottage cheese, Cool Whip Free, soy yogurt 6, 6 None or nonfat yogurt, nonfat sour cream, nonfat cottage cheese

Field.ElementLabel: 8. Which frozen desserts are you most likely to eat at least once a month?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Regular ice cream (5 g to 18 g fat per ½ cup) 2, 2 Light ice cream (4 g fat per ½ cup) 3, 3 Ice milk, most soft ice cream, frozen yogurt (cream added), Tofutti 4, 4 Sherbet, low-fat frozen yogurt, Soy Delicious 5, 5 None or nonfat frozen yogurt, sorbets, Popsicles

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Regular ice cream (5 g to 18 g fat per ½ cup)
2 Light ice cream (4 g fat per ½ cup)

Field.ElementLabel: 9. Which kind of cheese do you use?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 2, 2 Cheddar, Swiss, Jack, Brie, Feta, Montrachet, Blue, Jarlsberg, whole milk mozzarella, Neufchatel or regular cream cheese, processed cheese (Velveeta, American, Cheese Whiz), Kraft Delux Slices, Easy Cheese, Parmesan 5, 5 Part-skim mozzarella, light cream cheese, light Cheddar, light Jack, (Kraft Light Naturals, Alpine Lace-Lo, Velveeta Light or other part-skim cheeses), Cabot Vermont Cheddar (50% Light), string cheese 8, 8 Jarlsberg Lite, Athenos Reduced Fat Feta Cheese 10, 10 Light part-skim mozzarella, low-fat and light ricotta, Lite-Line, nonfat Parmesan, Cabot Vermont Cheddar (75% Light), Parm Plus, soy/rice cheese (cheddar, mozzarella) 12, 12 None or fat free cheeses (Cheddar, Jack, ricotta, cream, Healthy Choice, Alpine Lace, etc), soy (Tofu Rella), Almond (cheddar, mozzarella, etc)

Field.ElementLabel: 10. Check the type and number of "visible" eggs you eat (scrambled, fried, etc).

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Six or more whole eggs a week 2, 2 Three to five whole eggs a week 3, 3 One to two whole eggs a week 4, 4 One whole egg a month 5, 5 None or egg whites, egg substitute (Nulaid, Egg Beaters, Scramblers, Second Nature, etc)

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Six or more whole eggs <u>a week</u>
2 Three to five whole eggs <u>a week</u>
3 One to two whole eggs <u>a week</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 11. Check the type of eggs usually used in food prepared at home or bought in grocery stores.

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Whole eggs or mixes containing whole eggs (complete pancake mix, slice-and-bake cookies, etc) \n 3, 3 Combination of egg whites, egg substitute and whole eggs \n 5, 5 None or egg whites, egg substitute

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Whole eggs or mixes containing whole eggs (complete pancake mix

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
FATS AND OILS
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all numbers that apply.
Field.ElementLabel: 12. Which kinds of fats are used most often to cook your food (vegetables, meats, etc)?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Butter, shortening (with animal fat), lard, bacon grease, chicken fat 
 2, 2 Shortening (with vegetable fat), vegetable oil (cottonseed) 
 3, 3 Tub or stick margarine (all except canola), vegetable oil (soybean, olive) 
 4, 4 Vegetable oil (safflower, corn), tub or stick margarine (canola) 
 5, 5 Vegetable oil (canola) 
 6, 6 None or use nonstick cooking spray

StructuredValue.Value: 3 Tub or stick margarine (all except canola)
6 None or use nonstick cooking spray

Field.ElementLabel:
13. How much of these "added" fats do you eat in the typical day: peanut butter, margarine, mayonnaise, or salad dressing (including those made with olive oil)? Do not count fat free products.

Examples of amounts people often use:
on toast: 2 tsp margarine
on salads: 12 tsp salad dressing
on vegetables: 3 tsp margarine
on sandwiches: 6 tsp mayonnaise, 2 tsp margarine
on potatoes: 3 tsp margarine
on pasta, rice: 3 tsp margarine, oil or 6 tsp pesto

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Ten teaspoons or more 
 2, 2 Eight to 9 teaspoons 
 3, 3 Six to 7 teaspoons 
 4, 4 Four to 5 teaspoons 
 5, 5 Three teaspoons 
 6, 6 None

Field.ElementLabel: 14. How often do you eat potato chips, corn or tortilla chips, fried chicken, fish sticks, French fries, doughnuts, other fried foods, croissants or Danish pastries? Do not count fat free products

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Two or more times <u>a day</u> 
 2, 2 Once <u>a day</u> 
 3, 3 Two to 4 times <u>a week</u> 
 4, 4 Once <u>a week</u> 
 5, 5 Less than twice <u>a month</u> 
 6, 6 Never

Field.ElementLabel: 15. Which best describes the amount of margarine, butter, peanut butter, mayonnaise or cream cheese that you put on breads, muffins, bagels, etc? Do not count fat free products

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Average 
 2, 2 Lightly spread (can see the bread through it) 
 4, 4 "Scrape" (can barely see the spread) 
 5, 5 None

StructuredValue.Value: 2 Lightly spread (can see the bread through it)

Field.ElementLabel: 16. Which kind of salad dressings do you use?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Real mayonnaise 2, 2 Miracle Whip, light mayo, Caesar, Thousand Island dressing 3, 3 Best Food's Low-Fat Mayo (1gm fat/Tbs), Ranch, French, Blue Cheese or Roquefort, vinegar and oil, Italian, Russian, low-fat mayonnaise dressing, Miracle Whip Light dressing and Italian dressings 4, 4 Ranch Dressing (mix and light mayo) 5, 5 Low-cal salad dressing, Ranch Dressing (mix and low-fat yogurt) 6, 6 Use no salad dressing or fat free mayonnaise, Miracle Whip fat free, fat free salad dressings, Ranch dressing (mix and nonfat dairy or yogurt/sour cream), vinegar, lemon juice

StructuredValue.Value: 6 Use no salad dressing or fat free mayonnaise

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
SWEETS AND SNACKS
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all numbers that apply.
Field.ElementLabel: 17. How often do you eat desserts or baked goods (sweet rolls, doughnuts, muffins, scones, cookies, cakes)? <u>Do not count fat free versions</u>

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Once a day 
 2, 2 Five to 6 times a week 
 3, 3 Three to 4 times a week 
 4, 4 Two times a week 
 5, 5 One time a week or less 
 6, 6 Never

StructuredValue.Value: 5 One time a week or less

Field.ElementLabel: 18. Which of the following desserts or snacks have you eaten in the last month?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Croissants, cheesecake, typical cakes with frosting 2, 2 Pies, cookies, cupcakes, muffins, scones, frosted doughnuts 3, 3 Granola bars (Nature Valley, Quaker Chewy) 4, 4 Low-fat muffins, desserts made using low-fat recipes, low-fat cookies (fig bars, ginger snaps, Snackwell's), low-fat granola bars (Power Bar, Quaker Chewy low-fat) 5, 5 Fat free desserts including angel food cake, fat free cookies 6, 6 Never eat baked goods listed above or eat fruit for dessert

StructuredValue.Value: 5 Fat free desserts including angel food cake
6 Never eat baked goods listed above or eat fruit for dessert

Field.ElementLabel: 19. Which of the following snacks have you eaten in the last month?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Chocolate, commercial popcorn, Poppy Cock popcorn, caramel corn 2, 2 Nuts, potato chips, corn chips, Doritos chips, microwave popcorn, homemade popcorn w/butter, Cracker Jack, French fries, peanut butter, party/snack crackers (Ritz) 4, 4 Tortilla chips, baked potato chips, pretzels, light microwave popcorn, lightly buttered popcorn (1 tsp margarine for 3 cups popcorn), low-fat crackers (soda, graham), Toby's Tofu Pate Original 5, 5 Baked tortilla chips, homemade popcorn w/no fat, fat free soda crackers and other fat free crackers, Toby's Tofu Pate Lite 6, 6 Do not eat snacks or eat fruits and vegetables as snacks

StructuredValue.Value: 6 Do not eat snacks or eat fruits and vegetables as snacks

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
GRAINS, BEANS, FRUITS AND VEGETABLES
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For this part of the quiz, list the number of servings of the following foods you eat each day or week, as specified for the question.
Field.ElementLabel: 20. How many pieces of fruit or cups of fruit juice do you consume <u>a day</u>? (not "fruit-flavored" drinks)
21. How many cups of vegetables do you eat a day (tossed salad, cooked vegetables, soups, casseroles, etc)? (A typical serving size for tossed salad is 1 to 1 1/2 cups)
22. How many cups of legumes do you eat a week (refried beans, split peas, white beans, black beans, blackeye peas, lentils, chili, etc)?

23. List the number of servings of the following you ate last week. (A typical cereal bowl holds 1 1/2 to 2 cups; people typically eat 9 to 12 cups of popcorn).

Amount eaten LAST WEEK
cooked cereal
ready-to-eat cereal
English muffin
hamburger bun
bagel (plain or flavored)
Pita or pocket bread
eight-inch tortilla
plain popcorn (4 cups/serving)
Field.ElementNote: servings/week (1 microwave bag holds 10 ½ cups)

Field.ElementLabel: fat free or low-fat muffin
cornbread
Total
Amount eaten LAST WEEK
bread or toast
dinner or hard roll
French/Sourdough bread
four-inch pancake
low-fat crackers such as soda, graham, etc (8/serving)
regular sized rice cakes (3/serving)
mini sized rice cakes (8/serving)
pretzels (1 cup or 1 large soft)
Total

24. How many servings of grains and potatoes did you eat last week? Be sure to count these foods when they are in a mixed dish (casserole, burrito, etc). This includes breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Number of servings eaten LAST WEEK
macaroni, spaghetti and other pastas
mashed potato
baked potato
rice, corn, bulgur, barley, couscous, other grains

25. Which of the following reflects your habits regarding alcoholic beverages?

1 drink = 12 ounces beer
1 1/2 ounces whiskey, gin, rum, etc
4 ounces wine
1 ounce liqueur

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 One or more drinks <u>a day</u> 
 2, 2 Four to 6 drinks <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 Three drinks <u>a week</u> 
 4, 4 One to 2 drinks <u>a week</u> 
 5, 5 One to 3 drinks <u>a month</u> 
 6, 6 Do not drink alcoholic beverages

Field.ElementLabel:
26. Which of the following reflects your habits regarding soda pop, sweetened seltzers, sports drinks, fruit punch, etc? Do not count sugar free (diet) drinks

1 can = 12 ounces
Big Gulp = 32 ounces
1 Liter = 33 ounces
2 Liter = 67 ounces

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 More than 48 ounces <u>a week</u> 
 2, 2 33-48 ounces <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 25-32 ounces <u>a week</u> 
 4, 4 12-24 ounces <u>a week</u> 
 5, 5 None or less than 12 ounces <u>a week</u>

StructuredValue.Value: 5 None or less than 12 ounces <u>a week</u>

Field.ElementLabel:
27. How much coffee do you drink? This includes espressos, lattes, mochas, etc.

Guidelines for Espresso Drinks
"Short" = 8-10 ounces
Small ("Tall") = 12 ounces
Medium ("Grande") = 16 ounces
Large ("Venti") = 20 ounces

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 More than 40 ounces (more than 5 cups) <u>a day</u> 
 3, 3 25-40 ounces (4 to 5 cups) <u>a day</u> 
 4, 4 6-24 ounces (1 to 3 cups) <u>a day</u> 
 5, 5 None or less than (1 cup) <u>a day</u>

StructuredValue.Value: 1 More than 40 ounces (more than 5 cups) <u>a day</u>
5 None or less than (1 cup) <u>a day</u>

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
SALT
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all numbers that apply.
Field.ElementLabel: 28. Which type of "salt" do you normally use?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Regular salt, sea salt, flavoring salts (seasoned salt, garlic salt, onion salt, celery salt, lemon pepper, etc), regular soy sauce 3, 3 Combination of regular and Lite Salt 4, 4 Lite Salt, lower-sodium soy sauce, reduced-sodium flavoring salts 5, 5 None or salt substitute (100% potassium chloride), Salt-free products (Mrs. Dash, etc)

StructuredValue.Value: 5 None or salt substitute (100% potassium chloride)

Field.ElementLabel: 29. How often do you add salt to your food at the table?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Always 
 2, 2 Frequently 
 4, 4 Occasionally 
 5, 5 Never

Field.ElementLabel: 30. Which type of salt and how much do you use in cooking potatoes, rice, pasta, vegetables, meat, casseroles and soups?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Regular salt (typical amount) or eat in restaurants 4 or more times a week 2, 2 Regular salt (1/2 typical amount) or Lite Salt (typical amount) 4, 4 Lite Salt (1/2 typical amount) 5, 5 None or salt-free products (Mrs. Dash, etc), salt substitute

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Regular salt (typical amount) or eat in restaurants 4 or more times <u>a week</u>
2 Regular salt (1/2 typical amount) or Lite Salt (typical amount)

Field.ElementLabel: 31. Which type of cereals do you use?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Typical dry cereals (sweetened or unsweetened) or cereals cooked with regular salt (typical amount) \n 3, 3 Combination of typical dry cereals and salt-free dry cereals (Shredded Wheat, Puffed Wheat, Puffed Rice) or cereals cooked with regular salt (1/2 typical amount) or Lite Salt (typical amount) \n 5, 5 Do not eat cereal or eat salt-free dry cereals (Shredded Wheat, Puffed Wheat, Puffed Rice, etc) or cereals cooked without salt

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Typical dry cereals (sweetened or unsweetened) or cereals cooked with regular salt (typical amount)
3 Combination of typical dry cereals and salt-free dry cereals (Shredded Wheat
5 Do not eat cereal or eat salt-free dry cereals (Shredded Wheat

Field.ElementLabel:
32. How often do you use typical canned, bottled, or packaged foods:





















Salsasalad dressingsboxed noodle entrees
Picante saucesoups (chicken broth)frozen entrees
BBQ saucechilicanned beans
ketchupcured meats (lunch meat)canned vegetables

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 More than 15 times a week or eat in restaurant 4 or more times <u>a week</u> 
 2, 2 Ten to 14 times <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 Six to 9 times <u>a week</u> 
 5, 5 Five times <u>a week or less</u>

StructuredValue.Value: 1 More than 15 times a week or eat in restaurant 4 or more times <u>a week</u>

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
RESTAURANTS AND RECIPES
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all numbers or check the choices that apply.
Field.ElementLabel: 33. How often do you eat breakfast at a restaurant or cafeteria (this includes coffee shops)?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 More than twice <u>a week</u> 
 2, 2 Once or twice <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 Once <u>a week if you eat low-fat</u> (unbuttered toast or English muffin, oatmeal) 
 5, 5 Less than once <u>a month</u> 
 6, 6 Never

StructuredValue.Value: 3 Once <u>a week if you eat low-fat</u> (unbuttered toast or English muffin

Field.ElementLabel: 34. How often do you eat lunch at a restaurant or cafeteria or eat "take out"?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Daily 
 2, 2 Five days <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 Two to 4 days <u>a week</u> 
 4, 4 One day <u>a week</u> 
 5, 5 Less than once <u>a month</u> 
 6, 6 Never

Field.ElementLabel: 35. How often do you eat dinner at a restaurant or cafeteria or eat "take out"?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 More than 3 times <u>a week</u> 
 2, 2 Two to 3 times <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 Once <u>a week</u> 
 4, 4 Once or twice <u>a month</u> 
 5, 5 Less than once <u>a month</u> 
 6, 6 Never

Field.ElementLabel: 36. Check the choices you make when eating in restaurants or cafeterias.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, Select restaurants that offer low-fat choices and order those choices 
 2, Order toast, muffins, cereal, pancakes, waffles for breakfast 
 3, Order soup (not cream), salad or other meatless, cheeseless entrees for lunch 
 4, Order vegetarian pizzas with half the cheese 
 5, Avoid cheese, eggs, bacon on salads and avoid potato and macaroni salads 
 6, Put garbanzo or kidney beans on salad at the salad bar 
 7, Use a very small amount of salad dressing 
 8, Order a fish, shellfish, chicken or lean red meat entree (but not fried) 
 9, Use no more than 1 pat of margarine at any meal 
 10, Order fruit, sorbet, sherbet, frozen yogurt or skip dessert

StructuredValue.Value: Select restaurants that offer low-fat choices and order those choices
Order vegetarian pizzas with half the cheese
Put garbanzo or kidney beans on salad at the salad bar
Use a very small amount of salad dressing
Use no more than 1 pat of margarine at any meal

Field.ElementLabel: 37. How often do you eat foods made using low-fat recipes or cook low-fat without recipes?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Once <u>a month or less</u> 
 2, 2 One to 2 times <u>a week</u> 
 3, 3 Three to 4 times <u>a week</u> 
 4, 4 Five to 6 times <u>a week</u> 
 5, 5 Everyday

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader:
SEAFOOD
Consider your eating habits during the last month. For each question, choose all items that apply.
Field.ElementLabel: 38. How often do you eat fish? (tuna, snapper, perch, sole, halibut, cod, salmon, shrimp/prawns, crab, lobster, scallops, clams, oysters, sardines, etc).

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, 1 Do not eat fish or eat fish less than once a month 
 2, 2 One to 3 times a month 
 3, 3 Once a week 
 4, 4 Two times a week 
 5, 5 Three or more times a week or eat vegetarian with no added fat

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Do not eat fish or eat fish less than once a month
5 Three or more times a week or eat vegetarian with no added fat

Field.ElementLabel: 39. Which fish (fresh, frozen or canned) have you eaten in the last month?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, 1 Ate no fish in the last month 2, 2 2 Scallops, clams, mussels, snowcrab (surimi) 3, 3 White fish (perch, cod, sole, halibut, snapper), oyster, lobster, tuna, crab 4, 4 Trout, steelhead, herring, catfish, salmon (Atlantic, pink) 5, 5 Salmon (Coho, red, Chinook), mackerel, sardines, shrimp/prawns, squid or eat vegetarian with no added fat

StructuredValue.Value: 1 Ate no fish in the last month
